    {
      "title": "CVE-2021-25219",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "bind-export-libs",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `bind-export-libs` package._\n\nIn BIND 9.3.0 -&gt; 9.11.35, 9.12.0 -&gt; 9.16.21, and versions 9.9.3-S1 -&gt; 9.11.35-S1 and 9.16.8-S1 -&gt; 9.16.21-S1 of BIND Supported Preview Edition, as well as release versions 9.17.0 -&gt; 9.17.18 of the BIND 9.17 development branch, exploitation of broken authoritative servers using a flaw in response processing can cause degradation in BIND resolver performance. The way the lame cache is currently designed makes it possible for its internal data structures to grow almost infinitely, which may cause significant delays in client query processing.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `Centos:8` `bind-export-libs`.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://kb.isc.org/v1/docs/cve-2021-25219)\n- [CVE-2021-25219](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-25219)\n- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4994)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/YGV7SA27CTYLGFJSPUM3V36ZWK7WWDI4/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/YTKC4E3HUOLYN5IA4EBL4VAQSWG2ZVTX/)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/11/msg00001.html)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/EF4NAVRV4H3W4GA3LGGZYUKD3HSJBAVW/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20211118-0002/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `bind-export-libs` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nIn BIND 9.0.0 -&gt; 9.11.29, 9.12.0 -&gt; 9.16.13, and versions BIND 9.9.3-S1 -&gt; 9.11.29-S1 and 9.16.8-S1 -&gt; 9.16.13-S1 of BIND Supported Preview Edition, as well as release versions 9.17.0 -&gt; 9.17.11 of the BIND 9.17 development branch, when a vulnerable version of named receives a query for a record triggering the flaw described above, the named process will terminate due to a failed assertion check. The vulnerability affects all currently maintained BIND 9 branches (9.11, 9.11-S, 9.16, 9.16-S, 9.17) as well as all other versions of BIND 9.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `bind-export-libs` to version 32:9.11.26-4.el8_4 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://kb.isc.org/v1/docs/cve-2021-25215)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210521-0006/)\n- [CVE-2021-25215](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-25215)\n- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4909)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/VEC2XG4Q2ODTN2C4CGXEIXU3EUTBMK7L/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ZDSRPCJQ7MZC6CENH5PO3VQOFI7VSWBE/)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/05/msg00001.html)\n- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/04/29/1)\n- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/04/29/2)\n- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/04/29/3)\n- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/04/29/4)\n- [RHSA-2021:1469](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:1469)\n- [RHSA-2021:1989](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:1989)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

The cache could become poisoned with incorrect records leading to queries being made to the wrong servers, which might also result in false information being returned to clients.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `Centos:8` `bind-export-libs`.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-25220](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-25220)\n- [CONFIRM](https://kb.isc.org/v1/docs/cve-2021-25220)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/NYD7US4HZRFUGAJ66ZTHFBYVP5N3OQBY/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/API7U5E7SX7BAAVFNW366FFJGD6NZZKV/)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._\n\nA heap-based buffer over-read issue was discovered in the function sec_merge_hash_lookup in merge.c in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, because _bfd_add_merge_section mishandles section merges when size is not a multiple of entsize. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_arm_hp_template, demangle_class_name, demangle_fund_type, do_type, do_arg, demangle_args, and demangle_nested_args.       "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._\n\nAn issue was discovered in the merge_strings function in merge.c in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31. There is a NULL pointer dereference in _bfd_add_merge_section when attempting to merge sections with large alignments. A specially crafted ELF allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service, as demonstrated by ld.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `Centos:8` `binutils`.\n## References\n- [BID](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/105754)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190307-0003/)\n- [CVE-2018-18606](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2018-18606)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=23806)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=binutils-gdb.git;h=45a0eaf77022963d639d6d19871dbab7b79703fc)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00072.html)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-11/msg00008.html)\n- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4336-1/)\n",

The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `binutils` to version 0:2.30-108.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210521-0010/)\n- [CVE-2021-20284](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-20284)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1937784)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26931)\n- [RHSA-2021:4364](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4364)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nAn issue was discovered in the Bidirectional Algorithm in the Unicode Specification through 14.0. It permits the visual reordering of characters via control sequences, which can be used to craft source code that renders different logic than the logical ordering of tokens ingested by compilers and interpreters. Adversaries can leverage this to encode source code for compilers accepting Unicode such that targeted vulnerabilities are introduced invisibly to human reviewers.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `binutils` to version 0:2.30-108.el8_5.1 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-42574](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-42574)\n- [MISC](https://trojansource.codes)\n-     {
      "title": "Improper Validation of Integrity Check Value",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "curl",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `curl` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nWhen curl is instructed to download content using the metalink feature, thecontents is verified against a hash provided in the metalink XML file.The metalink XML file points out to the client how to get the same contentfrom a set of different URLs, potentially hosted by different servers and theclient can then download the file from one or several of them. In a serial orparallel manner.If one of the servers hosting the contents has been breached and the contentsof the specific file on that server is replaced with a modified payload, curlshould detect this when the hash of the file mismatches after a completeddownload. It should remove the contents and instead try getting the contentsfrom another URL. This is not done, and instead such a hash mismatch is onlymentioned in text and the potentially malicious content is kept in the file ondisk.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `curl` to version 0:7.61.1-18.el8_4.1 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210902-0003/)\n- [CVE-2021-22922](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22922)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/FRUCW2UVNYUDZF72DQLFQR4PJEC6CF7V/)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1213175)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r61db8e7dcb56dc000a5387a88f7a473bacec5ee01b9ff3f55308aacc@%3Cdev.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r61db8e7dcb56dc000a5387a88f7a473bacec5ee01b9ff3f55308aacc@%3Cusers.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rbf4ce74b0d1fa9810dec50ba3ace0caeea677af7c27a97111c06ccb7@%3Cdev.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rbf4ce74b0d1fa9810dec50ba3ace0caeea677af7c27a97111c06ccb7@%3Cusers.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [RHSA-2021:3582](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:3582)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

    {
      "title": "Use of Incorrectly-Resolved Name or Reference",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "curl",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `curl` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nlibcurl keeps previously used connections in a connection pool for subsequenttransfers to reuse, if one of them matches the setup.Due to errors in the logic, the config matching function did not take &#39;issuercert&#39; into account and it compared the involved paths *case insensitively*,which could lead to libcurl reusing wrong connections.File paths are, or can be, case sensitive on many systems but not all, and caneven vary depending on used file systems.The comparison also didn&#39;t include the &#39;issuer cert&#39; which a transfer can setto qualify how to verify the server certificate.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `curl` to version 0:7.61.1-18.el8_4.1 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210902-0003/)\n- [CVE-2021-22924](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22924)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/FRUCW2UVNYUDZF72DQLFQR4PJEC6CF7V/)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1223565)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r61db8e7dcb56dc000a5387a88f7a473bacec5ee01b9ff3f55308aacc@%3Cdev.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r61db8e7dcb56dc000a5387a88f7a473bacec5ee01b9ff3f55308aacc@%3Cusers.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rbf4ce74b0d1fa9810dec50ba3ace0caeea677af7c27a97111c06ccb7@%3Cdev.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rbf4ce74b0d1fa9810dec50ba3ace0caeea677af7c27a97111c06ccb7@%3Cusers.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00017.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:3582](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:3582)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `curl` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nWhen curl is instructed to get content using the metalink feature, and a user name and password are used to download the metalink XML file, those same credentials are then subsequently passed on to each of the servers from which curl will download or try to download the contents from. Often contrary to the user&#39;s expectations and intentions and without telling the user it happened.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `curl` to version 0:7.61.1-18.el8_4.1 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210902-0003/)\n- [CVE-2021-22923](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22923)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/FRUCW2UVNYUDZF72DQLFQR4PJEC6CF7V/)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1213181)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:3582](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:3582)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `curl` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nA user can tell curl &gt;= 7.20.0 and &lt;= 7.78.0 to require a successful upgrade to TLS when speaking to an IMAP, POP3 or FTP server (`--ssl-reqd` on the command line or`CURLOPT_USE_SSL` set to `CURLUSESSL_CONTROL` or `CURLUSESSL_ALL` withlibcurl). This requirement could be bypassed if the server would return a properly crafted but perfectly legitimate response.This flaw would then make curl silently continue its operations **withoutTLS** contrary to the instructions and expectations, exposing possibly sensitive data in clear text over the network.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `curl` to version 0:7.61.1-18.el8_4.2 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-22946](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22946)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RWLEC6YVEM2HWUBX67SDGPSY4CQB72OE/)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1334111)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/09/msg00022.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:4059](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4059)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20211029-0003/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/APOAK4X73EJTAPTSVT7IRVDMUWVXNWGD/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20220121-0008/)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT213183)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2022/Mar/29)\n",

      "title": "Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "curl",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `curl` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nWhen curl &gt;= 7.20.0 and &lt;= 7.78.0 connects to an IMAP or POP3 server to retrieve data using STARTTLS to upgrade to TLS security, the server can respond and send back multiple responses at once that curl caches. curl would then upgrade to TLS but not flush the in-queue of cached responses but instead continue using and trustingthe responses it got *before* the TLS handshake as if they were authenticated.Using this flaw, it allows a Man-In-The-Middle attacker to first inject the fake responses, then pass-through the TLS traffic from the legitimate server and trick curl into sending data back to the user thinking the attacker&#39;s injected data comes from the TLS-protected server.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `curl` to version 0:7.61.1-18.el8_4.2 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-22947](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22947)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RWLEC6YVEM2HWUBX67SDGPSY4CQB72OE/)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1334763)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/09/msg00022.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:4059](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4059)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20211029-0003/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/APOAK4X73EJTAPTSVT7IRVDMUWVXNWGD/)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT213183)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2022/Mar/29)\n",

      "credit": [

      "packageName": "curl",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `curl` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\ncurl 7.7 through 7.76.1 suffers from an information disclosure when the `-t` command line option, known as `CURLOPT_TELNETOPTIONS` in libcurl, is used to send variable=content pairs to TELNET servers. Due to a flaw in the option parser for sending NEW_ENV variables, libcurl could be made to pass on uninitialized data from a stack based buffer to the server, resulting in potentially revealing sensitive internal information to the server using a clear-text network protocol.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `curl` to version 0:7.61.1-22.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-22898](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22898)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/FRUCW2UVNYUDZF72DQLFQR4PJEC6CF7V/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/POOC3UV7V6L4CJ5KA2PTWTNUV5Y72T3Q/)\n- [MISC](https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2021-22898.html)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/39ce47f219b09c380b81f89fe54ac586c8db6bde)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1176461)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rc713534b10f9daeee2e0990239fa407e2118e4aa9e88a7041177497c@%3Cissues.guacamole.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00017.html)\n- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/07/21/4)\n- [N/A](https://www.oracle.com//security-alerts/cpujul2021.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:4511](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4511)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

      "title": "Information Exposure",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "curl",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `curl` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\ncurl 7.1.1 to and including 7.75.0 is vulnerable to an &#34;Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor&#34; by leaking credentials in the HTTP Referer: header. libcurl does not strip off user credentials from the URL when automatically populating the Referer: HTTP request header field in outgoing HTTP requests, and therefore risks leaking sensitive data to the server that is the target of the second HTTP request.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `curl` to version 0:7.61.1-22.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210521-0007/)\n- [CVE-2021-22876](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22876)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2ZC5BMIOKLBQJSFCHEDN2G2C2SH274BP/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ITVWPVGLFISU5BJC2BXBRYSDXTXE2YGC/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KQUIOYX2KUU6FIUZVB5WWZ6JHSSYSQWJ/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202105-36)\n- [MISC](https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2021-22876.html)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1101882)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/05/msg00019.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:4511](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4511)\n- [N/A](https://www.oracle.com//security-alerts/cpujul2021.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

      "title": "Use of Uninitialized Resource",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "curl",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `curl` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\ncurl supports the `-t` command line option, known as `CURLOPT_TELNETOPTIONS`in libcurl. This rarely used option is used to send variable=content pairs toTELNET servers.Due to flaw in the option parser for sending `NEW_ENV` variables, libcurlcould be made to pass on uninitialized data from a stack based buffer to theserver. Therefore potentially revealing sensitive internal information to theserver using a clear-text network protocol.This could happen because curl did not call and use sscanf() correctly whenparsing the string provided by the application.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `curl` to version 0:7.61.1-22.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210902-0003/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212804)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212805)\n- [CVE-2021-22925](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22925)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/FRUCW2UVNYUDZF72DQLFQR4PJEC6CF7V/)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Sep/39)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Sep/40)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1223882)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:4511](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4511)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `dbus` package._\n\nA use-after-free flaw was found in D-Bus Development branch &lt;= 1.13.16, dbus-1.12.x stable branch &lt;= 1.12.18, and dbus-1.10.x and older branches &lt;= 1.10.30 when a system has multiple usernames sharing the same UID. When a set of policy rules references these usernames, D-Bus may free some memory in the heap, which is still used by data structures necessary for the other usernames sharing the UID, possibly leading to a crash or other undefined behaviors\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `Centos:8` `dbus`.\n## References\n- [CVE-2020-35512](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2020-35512)\n- [MISC](https://bugs.gentoo.org/755392)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1909101)\n- [MISC](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/dbus/dbus/-/issues/305#note_829128)\n- [MISC](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35512)\n",

      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `dbus-daemon` package._\n\nA use-after-free flaw was found in D-Bus Development branch &lt;= 1.13.16, dbus-1.12.x stable branch &lt;= 1.12.18, and dbus-1.10.x and older branches &lt;= 1.10.30 when a system has multiple usernames sharing the same UID. When a set of policy rules references these usernames, D-Bus may free some memory in the heap, which is still used by data structures necessary for the other usernames sharing the UID, possibly leading to a crash or other undefined behaviors\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `Centos:8` `dbus-daemon`.\n## References\n- [CVE-2020-35512](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2020-35512)\n- [MISC](https://bugs.gentoo.org/755392)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1909101)\n- [MISC](https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/dbus/dbus/-/issues/305#note_829128)\n- [MISC](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35512)\n",

This flaw allows an attacker to achieve code execution if they can alter the header information of an RPM package and then trick a user or system into installing it. The highest risk of this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `dnf` to version 0:4.7.0-4.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-3445](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-3445)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/DPMFGGQ5T6WVFTFX3OKMVTTM5O4EXWZR/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/G4NL7TNWAHJ6JVRABQUPWHKKCTHUZMNF/)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1932079)\n- [RHSA-2021:4464](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4464)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `expat` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nIn Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3, a left shift by 29 (or more) places in the storeAtts function in xmlparse.c can lead to realloc misbehavior (e.g., allocating too few bytes, or only freeing memory).\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `expat` to version 0:2.2.5-4.el8_5.3 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-45960](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-45960)\n- [RHSA-2022:0951](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:0951)\n- [RHSA-2022:1069](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:1069)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/libexpat/libexpat/issues/531)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/libexpat/libexpat/pull/534)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1217609)\n- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2022/01/17/3)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20220121-0004/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2022-05)\n- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2022/dsa-5073)\n",

When g_file_replace() is used with G_FILE_CREATE_REPLACE_DESTINATION to replace a path that is a dangling symlink, it incorrectly also creates the target of the symlink as an empty file, which could conceivably have security relevance if the symlink is attacker-controlled. (If the path is a symlink to a file that already exists, then the contents of that file correctly remain unchanged.)\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `glib2` to version 0:2.56.4-156.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210416-0003/)\n- [CVE-2021-28153](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-28153)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/6RXTD5HCP2K4AAUSWWZTBKQNHRCTAEOF/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ICUTQPHZNZWX2DZR46QFLQZRHVMHIILJ/)\n- [MISC](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/glib/-/issues/2325)\n- [RHSA-2021:4385](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4385)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-13)\n",

      "title": "Use After Free",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "glibc",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nThe mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `glibc` to version 0:2.28-164.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210629-0005/)\n- [CVE-2021-33574](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-33574)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RBUUWUGXVILQXVWEOU7N42ICHPJNAEUP/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-07)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c1)\n- [RHSA-2021:4358](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4358)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KJYYIMDDYOHTP2PORLABTOHYQYYREZDD/)\n",

      "title": "Integer Overflow or Wraparound",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "glibc-common",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc-common` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nThe wordexp function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) through 2.33 may crash or read arbitrary memory in parse_param (in posix/wordexp.c) when called with an untrusted, crafted pattern, potentially resulting in a denial of service or disclosure of information. This occurs because atoi was used but strtoul should have been used to ensure correct calculations.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `glibc-common` to version 0:2.28-164.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210827-0005/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=28011)\n- [CONFIRM](https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=5adda61f62b77384718b4c0d8336ade8f2b4b35c)\n- [CVE-2021-35942](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-35942)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/glibc/wiki/Security%20Exceptions)\n- [RHSA-2021:4358](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4358)\n",

      "title": "Use After Free",
      "credit": [

      "packageName": "glibc-minimal-langpack",

      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc-minimal-langpack` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nThe mq_notify function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc) versions 2.32 and 2.33 has a use-after-free. It may use the notification thread attributes object (passed through its struct sigevent parameter) after it has been freed by the caller, leading to a denial of service (application crash) or possibly unspecified other impact.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `glibc-minimal-langpack` to version 0:2.28-164.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210629-0005/)\n- [CVE-2021-33574](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-33574)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RBUUWUGXVILQXVWEOU7N42ICHPJNAEUP/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-07)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27896#c1)\n- [RHSA-2021:4358](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4358)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KJYYIMDDYOHTP2PORLABTOHYQYYREZDD/)\n",

      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `glibc-minimal-langpack` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nThe nameserver caching daemon (nscd) in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.29 through 2.33, when processing a request for netgroup lookup, may crash due to a double-free, potentially resulting in degraded service or Denial of Service on the local system. This is related to netgroupcache.c.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `glibc-minimal-langpack` to version 0:2.28-164.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-27645](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-27645)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/7LZNT6KTMCCWPWXEOGSHD3YLYZKUGMH5/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/I7TS26LIZSOBLGJEZMJX4PXT5BQDE2WS/)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27462)\n- [RHSA-2021:4358](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4358)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-07)\n",

This flaw allows an attacker to force an invalid signature, causing an assertion failure or possible validation. The highest threat to this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `gnutls` to version 0:3.6.14-8.el8_3 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-20305](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-20305)\n- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4933)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/MQKWVVMAIDAJ7YAA3VVO32BHLDOH2E63/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202105-31)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1942533)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/09/msg00008.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:1145](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:1145)\n- [RHSA-2021:1206](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:1206)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20211022-0002/)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `kexec-tools` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nA flaw was found in the permissions of a log file created by kexec-tools. This flaw allows a local unprivileged user to read this file and leak kernel internal information from a previous panic. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality. This flaw affects kexec-tools shipped by Fedora versions prior to 2.0.21-8 and RHEL versions prior to 2.0.20-47.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `kexec-tools` to version 0:2.0.20-57.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-20269](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-20269)\n- [RHSA-2021:4404](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4404)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1934261)\n",

    {
      "title": "Improper Validation of Integrity Check Value",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "libcurl-minimal",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libcurl-minimal` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nWhen curl is instructed to download content using the metalink feature, thecontents is verified against a hash provided in the metalink XML file.The metalink XML file points out to the client how to get the same contentfrom a set of different URLs, potentially hosted by different servers and theclient can then download the file from one or several of them. In a serial orparallel manner.If one of the servers hosting the contents has been breached and the contentsof the specific file on that server is replaced with a modified payload, curlshould detect this when the hash of the file mismatches after a completeddownload. It should remove the contents and instead try getting the contentsfrom another URL. This is not done, and instead such a hash mismatch is onlymentioned in text and the potentially malicious content is kept in the file ondisk.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libcurl-minimal` to version 0:7.61.1-18.el8_4.1 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210902-0003/)\n- [CVE-2021-22922](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22922)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/FRUCW2UVNYUDZF72DQLFQR4PJEC6CF7V/)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1213175)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r61db8e7dcb56dc000a5387a88f7a473bacec5ee01b9ff3f55308aacc@%3Cdev.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r61db8e7dcb56dc000a5387a88f7a473bacec5ee01b9ff3f55308aacc@%3Cusers.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rbf4ce74b0d1fa9810dec50ba3ace0caeea677af7c27a97111c06ccb7@%3Cdev.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rbf4ce74b0d1fa9810dec50ba3ace0caeea677af7c27a97111c06ccb7@%3Cusers.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [RHSA-2021:3582](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:3582)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libcurl-minimal` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nWhen curl is instructed to get content using the metalink feature, and a user name and password are used to download the metalink XML file, those same credentials are then subsequently passed on to each of the servers from which curl will download or try to download the contents from. Often contrary to the user&#39;s expectations and intentions and without telling the user it happened.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libcurl-minimal` to version 0:7.61.1-18.el8_4.1 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210902-0003/)\n- [CVE-2021-22923](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22923)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/FRUCW2UVNYUDZF72DQLFQR4PJEC6CF7V/)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1213181)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:3582](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:3582)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libcurl-minimal` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nlibcurl keeps previously used connections in a connection pool for subsequenttransfers to reuse, if one of them matches the setup.Due to errors in the logic, the config matching function did not take &#39;issuercert&#39; into account and it compared the involved paths *case insensitively*,which could lead to libcurl reusing wrong connections.File paths are, or can be, case sensitive on many systems but not all, and caneven vary depending on used file systems.The comparison also didn&#39;t include the &#39;issuer cert&#39; which a transfer can setto qualify how to verify the server certificate.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libcurl-minimal` to version 0:7.61.1-18.el8_4.1 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210902-0003/)\n- [CVE-2021-22924](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22924)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/FRUCW2UVNYUDZF72DQLFQR4PJEC6CF7V/)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1223565)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r61db8e7dcb56dc000a5387a88f7a473bacec5ee01b9ff3f55308aacc@%3Cdev.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r61db8e7dcb56dc000a5387a88f7a473bacec5ee01b9ff3f55308aacc@%3Cusers.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rbf4ce74b0d1fa9810dec50ba3ace0caeea677af7c27a97111c06ccb7@%3Cdev.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rbf4ce74b0d1fa9810dec50ba3ace0caeea677af7c27a97111c06ccb7@%3Cusers.kafka.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/08/msg00017.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:3582](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:3582)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

This requirement could be bypassed if the server would return a properly crafted but perfectly legitimate response.This flaw would then make curl silently continue its operations **withoutTLS** contrary to the instructions and expectations, exposing possibly sensitive data in clear text over the network.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libcurl-minimal` to version 0:7.61.1-18.el8_4.2 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-22946](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22946)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RWLEC6YVEM2HWUBX67SDGPSY4CQB72OE/)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1334111)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/09/msg00022.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:4059](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4059)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20211029-0003/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/APOAK4X73EJTAPTSVT7IRVDMUWVXNWGD/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20220121-0008/)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT213183)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2022/Mar/29)\n",

      "title": "Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity",
      "credit": [

      "packageName": "libcurl-minimal",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libcurl-minimal` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nWhen curl &gt;= 7.20.0 and &lt;= 7.78.0 connects to an IMAP or POP3 server to retrieve data using STARTTLS to upgrade to TLS security, the server can respond and send back multiple responses at once that curl caches. curl would then upgrade to TLS but not flush the in-queue of cached responses but instead continue using and trustingthe responses it got *before* the TLS handshake as if they were authenticated.Using this flaw, it allows a Man-In-The-Middle attacker to first inject the fake responses, then pass-through the TLS traffic from the legitimate server and trick curl into sending data back to the user thinking the attacker&#39;s injected data comes from the TLS-protected server.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libcurl-minimal` to version 0:7.61.1-18.el8_4.2 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-22947](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22947)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/RWLEC6YVEM2HWUBX67SDGPSY4CQB72OE/)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1334763)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/09/msg00022.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:4059](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4059)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20211029-0003/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/APOAK4X73EJTAPTSVT7IRVDMUWVXNWGD/)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT213183)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2022/Mar/29)\n",

      "credit": [

      "packageName": "libcurl-minimal",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libcurl-minimal` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\ncurl 7.1.1 to and including 7.75.0 is vulnerable to an &#34;Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor&#34; by leaking credentials in the HTTP Referer: header. libcurl does not strip off user credentials from the URL when automatically populating the Referer: HTTP request header field in outgoing HTTP requests, and therefore risks leaking sensitive data to the server that is the target of the second HTTP request.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libcurl-minimal` to version 0:7.61.1-22.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210521-0007/)\n- [CVE-2021-22876](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22876)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2ZC5BMIOKLBQJSFCHEDN2G2C2SH274BP/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ITVWPVGLFISU5BJC2BXBRYSDXTXE2YGC/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KQUIOYX2KUU6FIUZVB5WWZ6JHSSYSQWJ/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202105-36)\n- [MISC](https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2021-22876.html)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1101882)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/05/msg00019.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:4511](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4511)\n- [N/A](https://www.oracle.com//security-alerts/cpujul2021.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libcurl-minimal` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\ncurl supports the `-t` command line option, known as `CURLOPT_TELNETOPTIONS`in libcurl. This rarely used option is used to send variable=content pairs toTELNET servers.Due to flaw in the option parser for sending `NEW_ENV` variables, libcurlcould be made to pass on uninitialized data from a stack based buffer to theserver. Therefore potentially revealing sensitive internal information to theserver using a clear-text network protocol.This could happen because curl did not call and use sscanf() correctly whenparsing the string provided by the application.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libcurl-minimal` to version 0:7.61.1-22.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210902-0003/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212804)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212805)\n- [CVE-2021-22925](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-22925)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/FRUCW2UVNYUDZF72DQLFQR4PJEC6CF7V/)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Sep/39)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/Sep/40)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1223882)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:4511](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4511)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcc` package._\n\nAn issue was discovered in the character definitions of the Unicode Specification through 14.0. The specification allows an adversary to produce source code identifiers such as function names using homoglyphs that render visually identical to a target identifier. Adversaries can leverage this to inject code via adversarial identifier definitions in upstream software dependencies invoked deceptively in downstream software.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `Centos:8` `libgcc`.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-42694](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-42694)\n- [MISC](https://trojansource.codes)\n- [MISC](http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode14.0.0/)\n- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/11/01/1)\n- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/11/01/6)\n- [CERT-VN](https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/999008)\n- [MISC](https://www.scyon.nl/post/trojans-in-your-source-code)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcc` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nAn issue was discovered in the Bidirectional Algorithm in the Unicode Specification through 14.0. It permits the visual reordering of characters via control sequences, which can be used to craft source code that renders different logic than the logical ordering of tokens ingested by compilers and interpreters. Adversaries can leverage this to encode source code for compilers accepting Unicode such that targeted vulnerabilities are introduced invisibly to human reviewers.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libgcc` to version 0:8.5.0-4.el8_5 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-42574](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-42574)\n- [MISC](https://trojansource.codes)\n- (The C implementation is used on platforms where an assembly-language implementation is unavailable.)       "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt` package._\n\nThe ElGamal implementation in Libgcrypt before 1.9.4 allows plaintext recovery because, during interaction between two cryptographic libraries, a certain dangerous combination of the prime defined by the receiver&#39;s public key, the generator defined by the receiver&#39;s public key, and the sender&#39;s ephemeral exponents can lead to a cross-configuration attack against OpenPGP.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `Centos:8` `libgcrypt`.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-40528](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-40528)\n- [MISC](https://eprint.iacr.org/2021/923)\n- [MISC](https://ibm.github.io/system-security-research-updates/2021/07/20/insecurity-elgamal-pt1)\n- [MISC](https://ibm.github.io/system-security-research-updates/2021/09/06/insecurity-elgamal-pt2)\n- [MISC](https://git.gnupg.org/cgi-bin/gitweb.cgi?p=libgcrypt.git;a=commit;h=3462280f2e23e16adf3ed5176e0f2413d8861320)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libgcrypt` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nLibgcrypt before 1.8.8 and 1.9.x before 1.9.3 mishandles ElGamal encryption because it lacks exponent blinding to address a side-channel attack against mpi_powm, and the window size is not chosen appropriately. This, for example, affects use of ElGamal in OpenPGP.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libgcrypt` to version 0:1.8.5-6.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-33560](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-33560)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/BKKTOIGFW2SGN3DO2UHHVZ7MJSYN4AAB/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/R7OAPCUGPF3VLA7QAJUQSL255D4ITVTL/)\n- [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/rCe8b7f10be275bcedb5fc05ed4837a89bfd605c61)\n- [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T5305)\n- [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T5328)\n- [MISC](https://dev.gnupg.org/T5466)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/06/msg00021.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:4409](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4409)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n",

      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libsepol` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nThe CIL compiler in SELinux 3.2 has a heap-based buffer over-read in ebitmap_match_any (called indirectly from cil_check_neverallow). This occurs because there is sometimes a lack of checks for invalid statements in an optional block.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libsepol` to version 0:2.9-3.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-36087](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-36087)\n- [MISC](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=32675)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz-vulns/blob/main/vulns/selinux/OSV-2021-585.yaml)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/SELinuxProject/selinux/commit/bad0a746e9f4cf260dedba5828d9645d50176aac)\n- [RHSA-2021:4513](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4513)\n- [MISC](https://lore.kernel.org/selinux/CAEN2sdqJKHvDzPnxS-J8grU8fSf32DDtx=kyh84OsCq_Vm+yaQ@mail.gmail.com/T/)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/SELinuxProject/selinux/commit/340f0eb7f3673e8aacaf0a96cbfcd4d12a405521)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/U7ZYR3PIJ75N6U2IONJWCKZ5L2NKJTGR/)\n",

The specification allows an adversary to produce source code identifiers such as function names using homoglyphs that render visually identical to a target identifier. Adversaries can leverage this to inject code via adversarial identifier definitions in upstream software dependencies invoked deceptively in downstream software.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `Centos:8` `libstdc++`.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-42694](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-42694)\n- [MISC](https://trojansource.codes)\n- [MISC](http://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode14.0.0/)\n- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/11/01/1)\n- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/11/01/6)\n- [CERT-VN](https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/999008)\n- [MISC](https://www.scyon.nl/post/trojans-in-your-source-code)\n",

It permits the visual reordering of characters via control sequences, which can be used to craft source code that renders different logic than the logical ordering of tokens ingested by compilers and interpreters. Adversaries can leverage this to encode source code for compilers accepting Unicode such that targeted vulnerabilities are introduced invisibly to human reviewers.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libstdc++` to version 0:8.5.0-4.el8_5 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-42574](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-42574)\n- [MISC](https://trojansource.codes)\n- An attacker who is able to submit a crafted file to be processed by xmllint could trigger a use-after-free. The greatest impact of this flaw is to confidentiality, integrity, and availability.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libxml2` to version 0:2.9.7-9.el8_4.2 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210716-0005/)\n- [CVE-2021-3516](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-3516)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/BZOMV5J4PMZAORVT64BKLV6YIZAFDGX6/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/QVM4UJ3376I6ZVOYMHBNX4GY3NIV52WV/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-05)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1954225)\n- [MISC](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/commit/1358d157d0bd83be1dfe356a69213df9fac0b539)\n- [MISC](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/issues/230)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/05/msg00008.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:2569](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:2569)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n",

      "credit": [

      "packageName": "libxml2",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `libxml2` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nA vulnerability found in libxml2 in versions before 2.9.11 shows that it did not propagate errors while parsing XML mixed content, causing a NULL dereference. If an untrusted XML document was parsed in recovery mode and post-validated, the flaw could be used to crash the application. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libxml2` to version 0:2.9.7-9.el8_4.2 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210625-0002/)\n- [CVE-2021-3537](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-3537)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/BZOMV5J4PMZAORVT64BKLV6YIZAFDGX6/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/QVM4UJ3376I6ZVOYMHBNX4GY3NIV52WV/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-05)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1956522)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/05/msg00008.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:2569](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:2569)\n",

An attacker who is able to supply a crafted file to be processed by an application linked with the affected functionality of libxml2 could trigger an out-of-bounds read. The most likely impact of this flaw is to application availability, with some potential impact to confidentiality and integrity if an attacker is able to use memory information to further exploit the application.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `libxml2` to version 0:2.9.7-9.el8_4.2 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210625-0002/)\n- [CVE-2021-3517](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-3517)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/BZOMV5J4PMZAORVT64BKLV6YIZAFDGX6/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/QVM4UJ3376I6ZVOYMHBNX4GY3NIV52WV/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-05)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1954232)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/05/msg00008.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:2569](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:2569)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20211022-0004/)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n",

      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `lz4-libs` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nThere&#39;s a flaw in lz4. An attacker who submits a crafted file to an application linked with lz4 may be able to trigger an integer overflow, leading to calling of memmove() on a negative size argument, causing an out-of-bounds write and/or a crash. The greatest impact of this flaw is to availability, with some potential impact to confidentiality and integrity as well.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `lz4-libs` to version 0:1.8.3-3.el8_4 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-3520](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-3520)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1954559)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [N/A](https://www.oracle.com//security-alerts/cpujul2021.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:2575](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:2575)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20211104-0005/)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `nettle` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nA flaw was found in Nettle in versions before 3.7.2, where several Nettle signature verification functions (GOST DSA, EDDSA &amp; ECDSA) result in the Elliptic Curve Cryptography point (ECC) multiply function being called with out-of-range scalers, possibly resulting in incorrect results. This flaw allows an attacker to force an invalid signature, causing an assertion failure or possible validation. The highest threat to this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `nettle` to version 0:3.4.1-4.el8_3 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2021-20305](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-20305)\n- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4933)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/MQKWVVMAIDAJ7YAA3VVO32BHLDOH2E63/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202105-31)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1942533)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/09/msg00008.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:1145](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:1145)\n- [RHSA-2021:1206](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:1206)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20211022-0002/)\n",

    {
      "title": "Integer Overflow or Wraparound",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "openssl-libs",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `openssl-libs` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nThe OpenSSL public API function X509_issuer_and_serial_hash() attempts to create a unique hash value based on the issuer and serial number data contained within an X509 certificate. However it fails to correctly handle any errors that may occur while parsing the issuer field (which might occur if the issuer field is maliciously constructed). This may subsequently result in a NULL pointer deref and a crash leading to a potential denial of service attack. The function X509_issuer_and_serial_hash() is never directly called by OpenSSL itself so applications are only vulnerable if they use this function directly and they use it on certificates that may have been obtained from untrusted sources. OpenSSL versions 1.1.1i and below are affected by this issue. Users of these versions should upgrade to OpenSSL 1.1.1j. OpenSSL versions 1.0.2x and below are affected by this issue. However OpenSSL 1.0.2 is out of support and no longer receiving public updates. Premium support customers of OpenSSL 1.0.2 should upgrade to 1.0.2y. Other users should upgrade to 1.1.1j. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1j (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1i). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2y (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2x).\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `openssl-libs` to version 1:1.1.1k-4.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=122a19ab48091c657f7cb1fb3af9fc07bd557bbf)\n- [CONFIRM](https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=8252ee4d90f3f2004d3d0aeeed003ad49c9a7807)\n- [CONFIRM](https://kb.pulsesecure.net/articles/Pulse_Security_Advisories/SA44846)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210219-0009/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210513-0002/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212528)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212529)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT212534)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.openssl.org/news/secadv/20210216.txt)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2021-03)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2021-09)\n- [CVE-2021-23841](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-23841)\n- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4855)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/May/67)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/May/68)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2021/May/70)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202103-03)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuApr2021.html)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [N/A](https://www.oracle.com//security-alerts/cpujul2021.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:3798](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:3798)\n- [RHSA-2021:4198](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4198)\n- [RHSA-2021:4424](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4424)\n",

    {
      "title": "Out-of-bounds Read",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "openssl-libs",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `openssl-libs` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nASN.1 strings are represented internally within OpenSSL as an ASN1_STRING structure which contains a buffer holding the string data and a field holding the buffer length. This contrasts with normal C strings which are repesented as a buffer for the string data which is terminated with a NUL (0) byte. Although not a strict requirement, ASN.1 strings that are parsed using OpenSSL&#39;s own &#34;d2i&#34; functions (and other similar parsing functions) as well as any string whose value has been set with the ASN1_STRING_set() function will additionally NUL terminate the byte array in the ASN1_STRING structure. However, it is possible for applications to directly construct valid ASN1_STRING structures which do not NUL terminate the byte array by directly setting the &#34;data&#34; and &#34;length&#34; fields in the ASN1_STRING array. This can also happen by using the ASN1_STRING_set0() function. Numerous OpenSSL functions that print ASN.1 data have been found to assume that the ASN1_STRING byte array will be NUL terminated, even though this is not guaranteed for strings that have been directly constructed. Where an application requests an ASN.1 structure to be printed, and where that ASN.1 structure contains ASN1_STRINGs that have been directly constructed by the application without NUL terminating the &#34;data&#34; field, then a read buffer overrun can occur. The same thing can also occur during name constraints processing of certificates (for example if a certificate has been directly constructed by the application instead of loading it via the OpenSSL parsing functions, and the certificate contains non NUL terminated ASN1_STRING structures). It can also occur in the X509_get1_email(), X509_REQ_get1_email() and X509_get1_ocsp() functions. If a malicious actor can cause an application to directly construct an ASN1_STRING and then process it through one of the affected OpenSSL functions then this issue could be hit. This might result in a crash (causing a Denial of Service attack). It could also result in the disclosure of private memory contents (such as private keys, or sensitive plaintext). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1l (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1k). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2za (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2y).\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `openssl-libs` to version 1:1.1.1k-5.el8_5 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=94d23fcff9b2a7a8368dfe52214d5c2569882c11)\n- [CONFIRM](https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=ccb0a11145ee72b042d10593a64eaf9e8a55ec12)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210827-0010/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.openssl.org/news/secadv/20210824.txt)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2021-16)\n- [CVE-2021-3712](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-3712)\n- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4963)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r18995de860f0e63635f3008fd2a6aca82394249476d21691e7c59c9e@%3Cdev.tomcat.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rad5d9f83f0d11fb3f8bb148d179b8a9ad7c6a17f18d70e5805a713d1@%3Cdev.tomcat.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/09/msg00014.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2021/09/msg00021.html)\n- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/08/26/2)\n- [RHSA-2021:5226](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:5226)\n- [RHSA-2022:0064](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:0064)\n- [CONFIRM](https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10366)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2022-02)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-244969.pdf)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

    {
      "title": "Integer Overflow or Wraparound",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "openssl-libs",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `openssl-libs` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nCalls to EVP_CipherUpdate, EVP_EncryptUpdate and EVP_DecryptUpdate may overflow the output length argument in some cases where the input length is close to the maximum permissable length for an integer on the platform. In such cases the return value from the function call will be 1 (indicating success), but the output length value will be negative. This could cause applications to behave incorrectly or crash. OpenSSL versions 1.1.1i and below are affected by this issue. Users of these versions should upgrade to OpenSSL 1.1.1j. OpenSSL versions 1.0.2x and below are affected by this issue. However OpenSSL 1.0.2 is out of support and no longer receiving public updates. Premium support customers of OpenSSL 1.0.2 should upgrade to 1.0.2y. Other users should upgrade to 1.1.1j. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1j (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1i). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2y (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2x).\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `openssl-libs` to version 1:1.1.1k-4.el8 or higher.\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=6a51b9e1d0cf0bf8515f7201b68fb0a3482b3dc1)\n- [CONFIRM](https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=9b1129239f3ebb1d1c98ce9ed41d5c9476c47cb2)\n- [CONFIRM](https://kb.pulsesecure.net/articles/Pulse_Security_Advisories/SA44846)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210219-0009/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.openssl.org/news/secadv/20210216.txt)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2021-03)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2021-09)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2021-10)\n- [CVE-2021-23840](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2021-23840)\n- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2021/dsa-4855)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202103-03)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuApr2021.html)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuoct2021.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r58af02e294bd07f487e2c64ffc0a29b837db5600e33b6e698b9d696b@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf4c02775860db415b4955778a131c2795223f61cb8c6a450893651e4@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E)\n- [N/A](https://www.oracle.com//security-alerts/cpujul2021.html)\n- [RHSA-2021:3798](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:3798)\n- [RHSA-2021:4198](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4198)\n- [RHSA-2021:4424](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2021:4424)\n- [CONFIRM](https://kc.mcafee.com/corporate/index?page=content&id=SB10366)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2022.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://cert-portal.siemens.com/productcert/pdf/ssa-389290.pdf)\n",

    {
      "title": "Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop')",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "openssl-libs",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "centos:8",
      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `openssl-libs` package._\n_See `How to fix?` for `Centos:8` relevant versions._\n\nThe BN_mod_sqrt() function, which computes a modular square root, contains a bug that can cause it to loop forever for non-prime moduli. Internally this function is used when parsing certificates that contain elliptic curve public keys in compressed form or explicit elliptic curve parameters with a base point encoded in compressed form. It is possible to trigger the infinite loop by crafting a certificate that has invalid explicit curve parameters. Since certificate parsing happens prior to verification of the certificate signature, any process that parses an externally supplied certificate may thus be subject to a denial of service attack. The infinite loop can also be reached when parsing crafted private keys as they can contain explicit elliptic curve parameters. Thus vulnerable situations include: - TLS clients consuming server certificates - TLS servers consuming client certificates - Hosting providers taking certificates or private keys from customers - Certificate authorities parsing certification requests from subscribers - Anything else which parses ASN.1 elliptic curve parameters Also any other applications that use the BN_mod_sqrt() where the attacker can control the parameter values are vulnerable to this DoS issue. In the OpenSSL 1.0.2 version the public key is not parsed during initial parsing of the certificate which makes it slightly harder to trigger the infinite loop. However any operation which requires the public key from the certificate will trigger the infinite loop. In particular the attacker can use a self-signed certificate to trigger the loop during verification of the certificate signature. This issue affects OpenSSL versions 1.0.2, 1.1.1 and 3.0. It was addressed in the releases of 1.1.1n and 3.0.2 on the 15th March 2022. Fixed in OpenSSL 3.0.2 (Affected 3.0.0,3.0.1). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.1n (Affected 1.1.1-1.1.1m). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2zd (Affected 1.0.2-1.0.2zc).\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `Centos:8` `openssl-libs` to version 1:1.1.1k-6.el8_5 or higher.\n## References\n- [CVE-2022-0778](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2022-0778)\n- [RHSA-2022:1065](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:1065)\n- [RHSA-2022:1066](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2022:1066)\n- [CONFIRM](https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=380085481c64de749a6dd25cdf0bcf4360b30f83)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.openssl.org/news/secadv/20220315.txt)\n- [CONFIRM](https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=a466912611aa6cbdf550cd10601390e587451246)\n- [CONFIRM](https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commitdiff;h=3118eb64934499d93db3230748a452351d1d9a65)\n- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2022/dsa-5103)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/03/msg00024.html)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2022/03/msg00023.html)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20220321-0002/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/GDB3GQVJPXJE7X5C5JN6JAA4XUDWD6E6/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://psirt.global.sonicwall.com/vuln-detail/SNWLID-2022-0002)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2022-06)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.tenable.com/security/tns-2022-07)\n",

      "description": "## NVD Description\n**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `platform-python` package._\n\nA flaw was found in Python, specifically within the urllib.parse module. This module helps break Uniform Resource Locator (URL) strings into components. The issue involves how the urlparse method does not sanitize input and allows characters like &#39;\\r&#39; and &#39;\\n&#39; in the URL path. This flaw allows an attacker to input a crafted URL, leading to injection attacks. This flaw affects Python versions prior to 3.10.0b1, 3.9.5, 3.8.11, 3.7.11 and 3.6.14.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `Centos:8` `platform-python`.\n## References\n- [CVE-2022-0391](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/CVE-2022-0391)\n- [MISC](https://bugs.python.org/issue43882)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/CSD2YBXP3ZF44E44QMIIAR5VTO35KTRB/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/UDBDBAU6HUPZHISBOARTXZ5GKHF2VH5U/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20220225-0009/)\n",
